xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:title: USGCB: Guidance for Securing Microsoft Windows 7 energy settings
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:description: This guide has been created to assist IT professionals, in effectively configuring energy conserving settings on systems with Microsoft Windows 7
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:notice: Do not attempt to implement any of the settings in this guide without first testing them in a non-operational environment. NIST assumes no responsibility whatsoever for its use by other parties, and makes no guarantees, expressed or implied, about its quality, reliability, or any other characteristic. NIST would appreciate acknowledgement if the document and template are used.
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:front-matter: The Federal CIO council created the Technology Information Subcommittee (TIS) at the direction of OMB to govern, among other federal activities, the FDCC iniatitive. The TIS, based on federal agency input, selects platforms and applcations for federal implementation. The TIS also is the Change Control Board (CCB) for configuration settings. As stated in the Federal CIO Council Memo to federal agencies, "The USGCB settings replace the Federal Desktop Core Configuration (FDCC) settings and provide the recommended security baselines for Information Technology products widely deployed across the agencies."
xccdf:Benchmark.xccdf:rear-matter:
Trademark Information
Microsoft, Windows, Windows 7, Windows XP, Windows Vista, Internet Explorer, and Windows Firewall are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and other countries.
All other names are registered trademarks or trademarks of their respective companies.

xccdf:reference.dc:publisher: National Institute of Standards and Technology

xccdf:metadata.publisher: National Institute of Standards and Technology
xccdf:metadata.dc:creator: National Institute of Standards and Technology
xccdf:metadata.dc:contributor: National Institute of Standards and Technology

xccdf:Profile.xccdf:title: United States Government Configuration Baseline version 2.0.5.1
xccdf:Profile.xccdf:description: This profile represents guidance for energy conservation for Windows 7 on desktop systems.

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: Introduction
xccdf:Group.xccdf:description: This guide has been created to assist federal agencies in configuring systems running Microsoft Windows 7 with energy conservation recommended by the EPA.Under the direction of OMB and in collaboration with DHS, DISA, NSA, USAF, and Microsoft, NIST has provided the following baseline to help agencies test, implement, and deploy the Microsoft Windows 7 United States Government Configuration Baseline (USGCB) baseline. The United States Government Configuration Baseline (USGCB) is an OMB-mandated security configuration.Please refer to the USGCB home page for additional information. http://USGCB.nist.gov

xccdf:Group.xccdf:title: USGCB Energy Settings
xccdf:Group.xccdf:description: USGCB has identified the following additional controls that must be checked in order to verify compliance.

xccdf:Value.xccdf:title: Specify the System Hibernate\Sleep Timeout (On Battery)
xccdf:Value.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows transitions the system to hibernate or sleep.

xccdf:Value.xccdf:title: Specify the System Hibernate\Sleep Timeout (Plugged In)
xccdf:Value.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows transitions the system to hibernate or sleep.

xccdf:Value.xccdf:title: Turn off the Display (On Battery)
xccdf:Value.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows turns off the display.

xccdf:Value.xccdf:title: Turn off the Display (Plugged In)
xccdf:Value.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows turns off the display.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Specify the System Hibernate\Sleep Timeout (On Battery)
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows transitions the system to hibernate or sleep.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Specify the System Hibernate\Sleep Timeout (Plugged In)
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows transitions the system to hibernate or sleep.

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Turn off the Display (On Battery)
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows transitions the system to hibernate.

xccdf:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\System\Power Management\Video and Display Settings

xccdf:Rule.xccdf:title: Turn off the Display (Plugged In)
xccdf:Rule.xccdf:description: Specifies the period of inactivity before Windows turns off the display.

xccdf:reference.dc:source: Computer Configuration\Administrative Templates\System\Power Management\Video and Display Settings
